original: LJUNG, Olof Egil, Civilingenjör, Stockholm, f Sollefteå 14/2 00 av stins P E L o Ellen östman, gm Betty Abrahamsen. Studex Uddevalla 19, KTH (V o V) 19—23. Ing v AB Vat-tenbyggn.byrån i Sthlm sed. 25. Deltagit i projekterings- o konstr.arb i Sv, Finl, Ryssl, Lettl, Polen, Rumän, Siam o på Malacka samt f byråns räkn föret resor t Finl, Ryssl, Lettl, Polen o Siam. Studieresor t Tyskl, Schweiz o Österr 23, t Tyskl, Holl o Belg 36. Av Väg- 0 vattenbyggn.styr förklarad behörig upprätta arb.planer t hamn- o farledsföretag. Led av Sv Tekn.frn o Sv Konsult Ing:s Frn.
translated: LJUNG, Olof Egil, Civil Engineer, Stockholm, b. Sollefteå 14/2 00, son of stationmaster P.E.L and Ellen Östman, m. Betty Abrahamsen. Graduated from Uddevalla in 1919, KTH (Royal Institute of Technology) 1919-1923. Employed by AB Vattenbyggnadsbyrån in Stockholm since 1925. Participated in project planning and construction work in Sweden, Finland, Russia, Latvia, Poland, Romania, Siam and Malacca, as well as business trips to Finland, Russia, Latvia, Poland and Siam. Study trips to Germany, Switzerland and Austria in 1923, and to Germany, the Netherlands and Belgium in 1936. Declared authorized by the Swedish Road and Waterway Board to establish work plans for port and waterway projects. Member of the Swedish Association of Engineers and the Swedish Consulting Engineers Association.

structured.name: Olof Egil Ljung

careerSummary.description: Participated in project planning and construction work in Sweden, Finland, Russia, Latvia, Poland, Romania, Siam, and Malacca.

expertise: Establishment of work plans for port and waterway projects
